flawed_nl_solution:
If James bought 400 fish, the number of fish that were bad is 20/100*400 = <<20/100*400=2000/1>>2000/1
The remaining fish that he used to make the sushi rolls is 400-2000/1 = <<400-2000/1=-1600>>-1600
If 40 fish are required to make one sushi roll, -1600 fish will make -1600/40 = <<-1600/40=-40>>-40 sushi rolls
#### -40

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 80, not 2000/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
